body: I don't think this is actually fixing the code correctly. View, reshape, and repeat allow varargs `view(1,2,3)` rather than `view([1,2,3])`. Allow `dim() == 0` here only handles the case of `view(3)`. It is also surprising to allow a 0-dim tensor to become an int list. It would be like allow `1` to become `std::vector<int>`.  This PR fixes these bugs by handling varargs correct (https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/pull/7444) but it is a bit messy and I have not had time to clean it up.

This PR fixes these bugs by handling varargs correct (#7444) but it is a bit messy and I have not had time to clean it up.
